# Coffee and Research are the best when they are hot.

Welcome.  
This is a quiet corner where I keep my thoughts on statistics, causal inference, and clinical research.  
Ideas — like good coffee — are best enjoyed while they are still warm.

---

<div class="project-card">

## R package cifmodeling

A toolkit for survival and competing risks analysis in R — the more technical side of my coffee-fueled research.

- Kaplan-Meier and Aalen-Johansen estimation and visualization  
- **Direct polytomous regression** of cumulative incidence functions
- Integration with **ggsurvfit**, **modelsummary**, and modern R workflows 

**[Visit the R package cifmodeling site](https://gestimation.github.io/cifmodeling/)**

</div>

<div class="project-card">

## Story and Quiz — *How I learned research from my father*

A Japanese series of short, warm stories about learning research. Through conversations between a father and daughter, the essentials of research unfold naturally.

- For readers who want to grasp the *feel* of research before opening a textbook  
- Light, conversational chapters you can read in a few minutes  
- From Study Design → Clinical Trials → Epidemiology → Regression → Causal Inference → Publication

**[Read the Story and Quiz series (in Japanese)](./jp/index.qmd)**
</div>

<div class="about-section">

## About the author

<img src="image/portrait.jpg" width="120" class="author-photo">

Shiro Tanaka is a biostatistician and Professor of Clinical Biostatistics at Kyoto University. He works at the intersection of causal inference and clinical research. He tends to think best with papers, R, and a cup of coffee within reach.
